articles.basic_headline: South Korea's SK Hynix to invest $75 billion by 2028 in AI, chips
articles.title: South Korea's SK Hynix to invest $75 billion by 2028 in AI, chips
articles.description: South Korea's SK Hynix , the world no.2 memory chip maker, will invest 103 trillion won ($74.6 billion) through 2028 to strengthen its chips business, focusing on AI, its parent SK Group said on Sunday.
articles.web: South Korea's SK Hynix to invest $75 billion by 2028 in AI, chips

articles.basic_headline: AI deals between Microsoft and OpenAI, Google and Samsung, in EU crosshairs
articles.title: AI deals between Microsoft and OpenAI, Google and Samsung, in EU crosshairs
articles.description: Microsoft's partnership with OpenAI could face an EU antitrust investigation as regulators singled out their exclusivity clauses while Google's artificial intelligence deal with Samsung also triggered scrutiny.
articles.web: AI deals between Microsoft and OpenAI, Google and Samsung, in EU crosshairs

articles.basic_headline: Biden awards up to $75 million in CHIPS Act grant to Entegris
articles.title: Biden awards up to $75 million in CHIPS Act grant to Entegris
articles.description: American Chip manufacturing supplier Entegris said on Wednesday that it has inked a preliminary deal with the Biden administration for funding of up to $75 million to aid the development of a new facility in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
articles.web: Biden awards up to $75 million in CHIPS Act grant to Entegris

thumbnail.caption: U.S. President Joe Biden holds a semiconductor chip as he speaks prior to signing an executive order, aimed at addressing a global semiconductor chip shortage, in the State Dining Room at the White House in Washington, U.S., February 24, 2021. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: U.S. President Biden signs an executive order on the economy at the White House in Washington
thumbnail.subtitle: U.S. President Biden signs an executive order on the economy at the White House in Washington

articles.basic_headline: South Korea halts battery maker's operations as it probes deadly blaze
articles.title: South Korea halts battery maker's operations as it probes deadly blaze
articles.description: South Korean authorities ordered a halt on Wednesday to the operations of a manufacturer of lithium batteries after a fire killed 23 people, as they investigate three company officials for suspected safety violations.
articles.web: South Korea halts battery maker's operations as it probes deadly blaze

thumbnail.caption: Emergency personnel work at the site of a deadly fire at a lithium battery factory owned by South Korean battery maker Aricell, in Hwaseong, South Korea, June 24, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Hong-ji/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Fire at a lithium battery factory, in Hwaseong
thumbnail.subtitle: Fire at a lithium battery factory, in Hwaseong

articles.basic_headline: S.Korea battery maker apologises for deadly fire but says it complied with safety rules
articles.title: South Korea battery maker apologises for deadly fire but says it complied with safety rules
articles.description: The CEO of a South Korean lithium battery manufacturer apologised on Tuesday following a massive factory fire that killed 23 workers, but said the company had complied with all required safety precautions and training.
articles.web: South Korea battery maker apologises for deadly fire but says it complied with safety rules

thumbnail.caption: Emergency personnel work at the site of a deadly fire at a lithium battery factory owned by South Korean battery maker Aricell, in Hwaseong, South Korea, June 24, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Hong-ji/File Photo

thumbnail.subtitle: Fire at a lithium battery factory, in Hwaseong

articles.basic_headline: Explainer: South Korea's SK Group considers asset sales, mergers as part of major overhaul
articles.title: Explainer: South Korea's SK Group considers asset sales, mergers as part of major overhaul
articles.description: South Korea's SK Group plans to hold a two-day strategy meeting starting Friday to discuss streamlining its business to focus on key areas including artificial intelligence, chips and batteries.
articles.web: South Korea's SK Group considers asset sales, mergers as part of major overhaul

articles.basic_headline: Lawyers on track for mid-year bonuses at US trial firm McKool Smith
articles.title: Lawyers on track for mid-year bonuses at US trial firm McKool Smith
articles.description: Dallas-based law firm McKool Smith, known for taking on high-stakes patent cases and other litigation, said it will pay its associates and other lawyers mid-year bonuses up to $30,000.
articles.web: Lawyers on track for mid-year bonuses at US trial firm McKool Smith

articles.basic_headline: South Korea's SK Innovation and SK E&S to pursue merger, newspaper says
articles.title: South Korea's SK Innovation and SK E&S to pursue merger, newspaper says
articles.description: South Korea's SK Innovation , parent of the country's largest oil refiner and battery maker SK On, is expected to pursue a merger with energy affiliate SK E&S, resulting in a 106 trillion won ($76.81 billion) asset company, a South Korean newspaper reported on Thursday.
articles.web: South Korea's SK Innovation and SK E&S to pursue merger, newspaper says

articles.basic_headline: Hyundai’s India IPO will have imitators
articles.title: Breakingviews: Hyundai’s India IPO will have imitators
articles.description: If Hyundai Motor's up to $3 billion initial public offering of its Indian business crystallises a premium valuation as easily as expected, other multinationals could rush to list their local operations in the South Asian nation.
articles.web: Breakingviews: Hyundai’s India IPO will have imitators

articles.basic_headline: Amazon hit with $122 mln US verdict in internet-advertising patent case
articles.title: Amazon hit with $122 mln US verdict in internet-advertising patent case
articles.description: Amazon must pay nearly $122 million for violating another company's rights in targeted internet advertising technology, a Texas federal jury said on Friday.
articles.web: Amazon hit with $122 mln US verdict in internet-advertising patent case

articles.basic_headline: IT leads Indian shares to record closing highs on US rate outlook
articles.title: IT leads Indian shares to record closing highs on US rate outlook
articles.description: Indian shares logged record closing highs on Thursday, amid a global rally after softer-than-expected U.S. inflation data bolstered expectations that the Federal Reserve would cut rates sooner rather than later.
articles.web: IT leads Indian shares to record closing highs on US rate outlook

articles.basic_headline: Samsung chief Lee discusses cooperation with Meta, Amazon and Qualcomm
articles.title: Samsung chief Lee discusses cooperation with Meta, Amazon and Qualcomm
articles.description: Samsung Electronics said on Thursday its chairman met with the heads of Meta , Qualcomm and Amazon this week to discuss cooperation and that topics included artificial intelligence, cloud services and chips.
articles.web: Samsung chief Lee discusses cooperation with Meta, Amazon and Qualcomm

thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout

articles.basic_headline: Samsung offers plan to speed up delivery of AI chips
articles.title: Samsung offers plan to speed up delivery of AI chips
articles.description: Samsung Electronics said its contract manufacturing business plans to offer a one-stop shop for clients to get their AI chips made faster, integrating its global No. 1 memory chip, foundry, and chip packaging services, to harness the AI boom.
articles.web: Samsung offers plan to speed up delivery of AI chips

articles.basic_headline: US weighs more limits on China's access to AI chips, Bloomberg reports
articles.title: US weighs more limits on China's access to AI chips, Bloomberg reports
articles.description: The Biden administration is considering further restrictions on China's access to chip technology used for artificial intelligence, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.
articles.web: US weighs more limits on China's access to AI chips, Bloomberg reports

articles.basic_headline: Vietnam eyes greener power but banks on coal to avert blackouts
articles.title: Vietnam eyes greener power but banks on coal to avert blackouts
articles.description: Lights are off and air conditioning is down at the headquarters of Vietnam's state-run electricity provider EVN as the country's top power utility tries to "lead by example" to avoid a repeat of last year's crippling blackouts, an official tells visitors.
articles.web: Vietnam eyes greener power but banks on coal to avert blackouts

articles.basic_headline: US to award Rocket Lab $23.9 mln to boost satellite, spacecraft chips
articles.title: US to award Rocket Lab $23.9 mln to boost satellite, spacecraft chips
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Tuesday it planned to award Rocket Lab $23.9 million to dramatically boost the production of compound semiconductors used in satellites and spacecraft.
articles.web: US to award Rocket Lab $23.9 mln to boost satellite, spacecraft chips

articles.basic_headline: Arm, Qualcomm legal battle seen disrupting AI-powered PC wave
articles.title: Arm, Qualcomm legal battle seen disrupting AI-powered PC wave
articles.description: A two-year legal battle pitting two tech titans threatens to disrupt an emerging wave of new personal computers powered by artificial intelligence, tech industry executives and experts say.
articles.web: Arm, Qualcomm legal battle seen disrupting AI-powered PC wave

articles.basic_headline: European nations compete for Chinese EV factories, jobs even as EU weighs tariffs
articles.title: European nations compete for Chinese EV factories, jobs even as EU weighs tariffs
articles.description: European governments may be wary of budget Chinese electric vehicles flooding their markets but they're also fiercely competing for a share of the manufacturing investment and jobs the new competitors bring.
articles.web: European nations compete for Chinese EV factories, jobs even as EU weighs tariffs

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout
articles.title: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout
articles.description: A workers' union at Samsung Electronics staged its first walkout on Friday, signalling more assertiveness among employees just as South Korea's most powerful conglomerate races to catch up in chips used in artificial intelligence.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout

thumbnail.caption: Members of National Samsung Electronics Union hold placards bearing their messages against the company in front of the company building while staging a walkout protest, in Seoul, South Korea, June 7, 2024.    REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics union in South Korea stages first walkout

articles.basic_headline: Novartis, Roche unit and others face Italy antitrust probe over eye drug
articles.title: Novartis, Roche unit and others face Italy antitrust probe over eye drug
articles.description: Italy's antitrust regulator said on Thursday it had launched an investigation into pharmaceutical companies including Novartis and Roche-controlled Genentech for having potentially restricted competition in the sale of an eye drug.
articles.web: Novartis, Roche unit and others face Italy antitrust probe over eye drug
